rename.from: [FR][UI] Click through to individual runs from metric plot
rename.to: [FR][UI] Enable clicking through to individual runs from metric plot

rename.from: [FR][UI] Enable clicking through to individual runs from metric plot
rename.to: [FR][UI] Enable clicking through to individual runs from metric plots

body:
Nice feature to have, but tooltip doesn't seem to be hoverable (link seems to be working though).

Related issue: https://github.com/plotly/plotly.js/issues/998

![link-in-toolip](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17039389/72034869-9c4ff800-32d9-11ea-8851-ac07bf90b248.gif)

We can set an on-click callback function on each line which shows a modal with the run link.

I used Ant Design's modal (https://ant.design/components/modal/).

![modal](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17039389/72038836-24d49580-32e6-11ea-8795-8e2316a7e774.gif)
Also, do you know if this modal behavior is also possible to implement e.g. for the scatter plot & parallel coordinates plot?

Thank you for coming up with a solution so quickly @harupy! Using this on-click fallback function seems the right way! 

One suggestion, a modal is a little bit disruptive, could we try a popover style instead? See the mockup attached. I also add the run info in the popover so a user can confirm the run is what he/she clicks on. Let us know what you think!

![JumpToTheRun](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1960721/72113174-93b8eb00-32f4-11ea-87b7-2f5a76f29a33.png)

The popover would be a better user flow. One consideration is what happens when there are multiple overlapping data points. The current plot shows all of those datapoints at the same time when you hover. In this case the popover would have to list all runs with a way to navigate to each. The current mock takes up too much space for that. E.g. you'd have to have one "jump to the run" button next to each run but only one close button.

Thank you @clemens-db for the feedback! In that case, we can change the layout as below to display multiple run links.  
![JumpToTheRun_multiple](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1960721/72116921-9e797d00-3300-11ea-8ffa-f7cab2820d1b.png)


@harupy Btw Clemens and I also discussed, if we can persist the tooltip when clicking on a data point, somehow add the "Jump to the run" in the tooltip UI, it would look more familiar to the users. See a similar example [here](https://public.tableau.com/en-us/gallery/2019-global-multidimensional-poverty-index?tab=viz-of-the-day&type=viz-of-the-day). 
![Example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1960721/72117208-aede2780-3301-11ea-8d18-13a3ecdef408.png)

 Not sure how hard that would be, may not worth the effort.
